title: Physical Science HiSET.2.3 (Q21)
prompt:
A researcher hypothesizes that the amount of minerals dissolved in a local lake at any given time changes with the temperature of the water.

Which of the following methods would be the best way for this researcher to take samples to test this hypothesis?
feedback: The best answer is to take samples and temperature readings from multiple places in the lake on days of different temperature throughout the year. Taking samples and temperature readings from multiple places in the lake gives the researcher multiple trials to compare. If the researcher only samples one location, there might be an unknown factor affecting that location. Taking samples on days of different temperature throughout the year provides the independent variable in the test; the water has to be different temperatures to test the theory.
